item.title: The Debt-Ceiling Debate Is a Farce, But Fiscal Policy Is a Fiasco
item.description: The debt ceiling is a self-imposed limit on the amount of money the US government can borrow. It has been raised 78 times since 1960, most recently in 2019. The current debt ceiling debate is a farce because it is clear that the US government will never default on its debt.

item.title: Debt Ceiling Is Kevin McCarthy's Problem to Fix, Not Joe Biden's
item.description: In recent weeks, the U.S. debt ceiling debate has been heating up, with Speaker Kevin McCarthy finding himself in a difficult position. The New York Times reports that McCarthy is facing a dilemma as he tries to navigate the competing interests of his Republican caucus and the Biden administration[^1].

item.title: Quirky Federal Spending Speeds Up Debt-Ceiling Clash
item.description: Quirky Federal Spending Speeds Up Debt-Ceiling Clash A bigger-than-anticipated federal deficit has pushed up the deadline for dealing with the US debt ceiling from sometime in the third quarter to any day now, according to a recent article published on Bloomberg Opinion ^1^.
